data.title: Chapter 11: Implementing security sector reform: a case study of Lesotho
data.meta_description: Lesotho’s security sector has a long history of interference with democratic processes, including the violent takeover of government, and human rights abuse. This chapter provides an historical overview of this history. It then explains the concept and scope of security sector reform and a range of commissions of inquiry and interventions, many under the auspices of the Southern African Development Community, aimed at making the security sector more respectful of the rule of law and human rights, and accountable for its actions. Particular attention is given to reports and initiatives since 2018 which have culminated in a national security policy and strategy.
